result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: The Defendant shall notify Attorney Dan Johns of any change of address or phone number within five (5) days of such change.  The Defendant shall have monthly contact with Attorney Dan Johns via phone or letter.  The Defendant shall pay the sum of $65/month to Attorney Dan Johns for monitoring this agreement.  The defendant shall successfully complete an AODA Evaluation and follow-through with any and all recommendations.  If the Evaluation recommends inpatient treatment, the Defendant shall sign releases to the Iron County Human Services Department and to Attorney Dan Johns.  Furthermore, the Defendant agrees the facility shall contact Attorney Dan Johns and the Iron County Department of Human Services when the Defendant leaves the facility.  The Defendant shall cooperate with the Iron County Department of Human Services and follow all of their recommendations.  Defendant shall sign a release allowing Attorney Dan Johns access to her records with the Iron County Department of Human Services.  Defendant shall submit to Random Drug Tests, including Lab Blood Draws upon request of the Iron County Dept. of Human Services, Law Enforcement or Attorney Dan Johns.  The Defendant's bond conditions will continue.  Bond shall be changed to a signature bond.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather Jo Hall in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls 16CF8, and 17CF11, 16CF26.  Cites appearances.  Review of DEJ.  Jason Sedovic from TAD is also present.  Mr. Sedovic gives report to Court.  Court congratulates def.  All cases dismissed.  Atty Filippo to look into expungement.  Court deems def not eligible at this time.  Adj.  10:03 a.m.  klr

This bond covers 16CF8, 116CF26, 17CF11.  Def shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No controlled substances.  Def shall submit to PBT and/or urinalysis testing upon demand of law enforcement.  Defendant shall be released on 5/10/17 to allow travel to Wasilla Alaska.  If defendant deviates or doesn't report to program or is ejected from program, is to return to Iron County.

Defendant, Heather J. Hall appears in person with atty Sam Filippo.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls 16CF8, 16CF26, 17CF11, cites appearances.  DA submits letter to court.  Def has no questions for court.  Court addresses def further.  Bond is to be amended to reflect def be released on 5/10 to Wasilla, Alaska.  If deviates or doesn't report to program or is ejected from program, is to return to Iron County.  Letter to be filed and made part of the record per court.  Adjourned at 10:35 a.m.  klr

Defendant Heather Jo Hall in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases, cites appearances.  Plea and sentencing today.  DEJ to be filed.  DA outlines terms.  DA requests that court make sure def understands all terms.  Defendant sworn in by Judge.  DA questions def re understanding conditions of DEJ.  Def understands.  DA requests that AODA be included as requirement of DEJ even though not specified in DEJ.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant understands all terms and requirement to attend AODA.  Asks court to sign DEJ.  Court agrees appropriate resolution and signs DEJ.  Bond is changed to signature bond w/ same conditions.  AODA appointment for 7/21 at 1:00 p.m.  klr
